Key Match Events: The Cavaliers trailed by 15 in the second quarter but rallied to win 105-100.
Darius Garland scored eight points in the fourth quarter to help the Cavaliers take the lead.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers became the 12th team in NBA history to start a season 11-0, with the 2015-16 Golden State Warriors holding the record after winning their first 24 games.
Others: Cam Johnson scored 23 points and Dennis Schroder and Cam Thomas had 22 apiece for the Nets.
The Cavaliers failed to score 110 points for the first time, ending their NBA-record streak of doing so in 10 consecutive wins to open a season.
